intro: Cyphostemma lynesii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, capsule-like fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cyphostemma lynesii is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its resilience to drought conditions.
